availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Z. Terrell (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of Joseph Z. Terrell and Martha W. Terrell. Married to Sally S. Terrell. Father of Ida Terrell, John Terrell, and Martha Terrell. Resident of Hanover County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Private in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment in the Confederate States Army from April 1864 to 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Hanover County, West District, p. 366B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Tharps District, p. 141. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 26. Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0124. Find A Grave, "Joseph Zachary Terrell (1838-1880)," Memorial #163614822, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=163614822&ref=acom (accessed September 21, 2017).
